body_html:
@drpngx

Yes, you are right. And I understand about the intention.
But the current VLOG does not output VLOG level, so I could not recognize what VLOG level is output.
So, I proposed to suppress the lower log level to recognize it. Of course, this is the best way to solve this problem.

Instead, if you approve to add VLOG level to the log message, it can also solve the problem too.

for example:

code:

VLOG(2) << "Debug";

VLOG output(V2 will be added):
2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I V2 tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] Debug

But I did not which method is better.

body:
@drpngx 

Yes, you are right. And I understand about the intention.
But the current VLOG does not output VLOG level, so I could not recognize what VLOG level is output.
So, I proposed to suppress the lower log level to recognize it. Of course, this is the best way to solve this problem.

Instead, if you approve to add VLOG level to the log message, it can also solve the problem too.

for example:

code:
```
VLOG(2) << "Debug";
```

VLOG output(V2 will be added):
2017-12-27 21:26:43.712063: I **V2** tensorflow/core/common_runtime/executor.cc:1557] Debug

But I did not which method is better.
